aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates good authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses). However, the application has critical security header deficiencies across multiple pages. Missing X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options headers on 4 pages expose the site to MIME-type sniffing and clickjacking attacks. Additionally, the absence of HSTS, CSP, and Permissions-Policy headers leaves the application vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks, XSS exploits, and malicious feature access. While SSL/HTTPS is correctly implemented and no data leakage was detected, the header gaps represent significant security gaps that should be remediated immediately.
recommendations: Add 'X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff' header to all pages (/, /services/send-transport, /quote, and /admin) to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Implement 'X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN' header consistently across all pages to prevent clickjacking; currently only present on /admin
Deploy 'Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains' header to enforce HTTPS-only communication and protect against downgrade attacks
Establish and deploy a Content-Security-Policy header with appropriate directives for script sources, style sources, and frame ancestors to mitigate XSS vulnerabilities
Add 'Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin' (or stricter) to control referrer information leakage across pages
Implement 'Permissions-Policy' header to restrict potentially dangerous browser features (camera, microphone, geolocation, etc.)
Test and verify header implementation across all pages using automated security scanning tools before production deployment
Consider implementing these headers at the web server level (nginx/Apache) or application middleware to ensure consistent application
